endpoints.description: Manage the collection of Linodes your account may access.

response.name: Linode
response.description: Linode objects describe a single Linode on your account.

schema.name: pages
schema.description: The total number of pages of results.

schema.name: results
schema.description: The total number of results.

schema.name: data
schema.description: All results for the current page.

schema.name: id
schema.description: This Linode's ID

description.descText: Toggle and set thresholds for receiving email alerts.
listItems: CPU Usage - % - Average CPU usage over 2 hours exceeding this value triggers this alert. (Range 0-2000, default 90)
Disk IO Rate - IO Ops/sec - Average Disk IO ops/sec over 2 hours exceeding this value triggers this alert. (Range 0-100000, default 10000)
Incoming Traffic - Mbit/s - Average incoming traffic over a 2 hour period exceeding this value triggers this alert. (Range 0-40000, default 10)
Outbound Traffic - Mbit/s - Average outbound traffic over a 2 hour period exceeding this value triggers this alert. (Range 0-10000, default 10)
Transfer Quota - % - Percentage of network transfer quota used being greater than this value will trigger this alert. (Range 0-400, default 80)

schema.name: cpu
schema.description: CPU Usage % (Range 0-2000, default 90). 0 to disable.

schema.name: io
schema.description: Disk IO Rate ops/sec (Range 0-100000, default 10000). 0 to disable.

schema.name: network_in
schema.description: Incoming Traffic Mbit/s (Range 0-40000, default 10). 0 to disable.

schema.name: network_out
schema.description: Outbound Traffic Mbit/s (Range 0-10000, default 10). 0 to disable.

schema.name: transfer_quota
schema.description: Transfer Quota % (Range 0-400, default 80). 0 to disable.

schema.name: backups
schema.description: Displays if backups are enabled, last backup datetime if applicable, and the day/window your backups will occur. Window is prefixed by a "W" and an integer representing the two-hour window in 24-hour UTC time format. For example, 2AM is represented as "W2", 8PM as "W20", etc. (W0, W2, W4...W22)

schema.name: schedule

methods.description: Returns a list of Linodes.
methods.name: GET

methods.description: Creates a new Linode.

region.description: A region ID to provision this Linode in.
region.name: region

type.description: A Linode type ID to use for this Linode.
type.name: type

label.description: The label to assign this Linode. Defaults to "linode".
label.limit: 3-32 ASCII characters limited to letters, numbers, underscores, and dashes, starting and ending with a letter, and without two dashes or underscores in a row
label.name: label

group.description: The group to assign this Linode. Defaults to "empty".
group.name: group

distribution.description: The Distribution to deploy this Linode with.  May not be included if 'backup' is sent.
distribution.name: distribution

root_pass.description:
The root password to use when sourcing this Linode from a distribution.
  • root_pass is required if the source provided is a distribution.
root_pass.name: root_pass

authorized_keys.description: An array of public SSH keys to be installed into the distribution's default user's `authorized_keys` file when creating a Linode.
authorized_keys.name: authorized_keys

stackscript_id.description:
The stackscript ID to deploy with this disk.
  • Must provide a distribution. Distribution must be one that the stackscript can be deployed to.
stackscript_id.name: stackscript_id

stackscript_data.description:
UDF (user-defined fields) for this stackscript. Defaults to "{}".
  • Must match UDFs required by stackscript.
stackscript_data.name: stackscript_data

backup_id.description: The Backup to restore to the newly created Linode.  May not be included if 'distribution' is sent.
backup_id.name: backup_id

backups_enabled.description: Subscribes this Linode with the Backup service. (Additional charges apply.) Defaults to "false".
backups_enabled.name: backups_enabled

booted.description: Whether the instance should be booted upon completion of creation. This defaults to true if created with a distribution.
booted.name: booted

endpoints.description: Boots a Linode.

config_id.description: Optional config ID to boot the linode with.
config_id.name: config_id

schema.name: config_id
schema.description: Optional config ID to boot the linode with.

endpoints.description: Clones a Linode to a new or existing Linode.

region.description: A region ID to provision this Linode in. Required when cloning to a new Linode.
region.name: region

type.description: A Linode type ID to use for this Linode. Required when cloning to a new Linode.
type.name: type

linode_id.description: An existing Linode can be a target clone location.
linode_id.name: linode_id

label.description: The label to assign this Linode when cloning to a new Linode. Defaults to "linode".
label.limit: 3-32 ASCII characters limited to letters, numbers, underscores, and dashes, starting and ending with a letter, and without two dashes or underscores in a row
label.name: label

group.description: The group to assign this Linode when cloning to a new Linode. Defaults to "empty".
group.name: group

backups_enabled.description: Subscribes this Linode with the Backup service when cloning to a new Linode. (Additional charges apply.) Defaults to "false".
backups_enabled.name: backups_enabled

disks.description: A list of disk ID's to include in the clone process. All disks attached to configs will be cloned from the source Linode if not provided.
disks.name: disks

configs.description: A list of config ID's to include in the clone process. All configs will be cloned from the source Linode if not provided.
configs.name: configs

schema.name: region
schema.description: A region ID to provision this Linode in. Required when cloning to a new Linode.

schema.name: type
schema.description: A Linode type ID to use for this Linode. Required when cloning to a new Linode.

schema.name: linode_id
schema.description: An existing Linode can be a target clone location.

schema.name: label
schema.description: The label to assign this Linode when cloning to a new Linode. Defaults to "linode".

schema.name: group
schema.description: The group to assign this Linode when cloning to a new Linode. Defaults to "empty".

schema.name: backups_enabled
schema.description: Subscribes this Linode with the Backup service when cloning to a new Linode. (Additional charges apply.) Defaults to "false".

schema.description: A list of disk ID's to include in the clone process. All disks attached to configs will be cloned from the source Linode if not provided.

schema.description: A list of config ID's to include in the clone process. All configs will be cloned from the source Linode if not provided.

schema.description: The service to append to an SRV record. Must conform to RFC2782 standards.

schema.description: The protocol to append to an SRV record. Must conform to RFC2782 standards.

schema.description: Time interval that the resource record may be cached before it should be discarded, in seconds. Leave as 0 to accept our default.

schema.description: The current page in the results.

        "protocol": "http",
        "algorithm": "roundrobin",

        "check_interval": 5,
        "check_timeout": 3,
        "check_attempts": 10,
        "check_path": "/path/to/check",

my_nodebalancer = linode.NodeBalancer(client, 123)

        algorithm='roundrobin', stickiness='none', check='http_body', check_interval=5, check_timeout=3,

ip2 = linode_2.ips.ipv4.public[0]

client.networking.assign_ips(linode_1.region, ip1.to(linode_2), ip2.to(linode_1))

methods.description: Get grants for a restricted user.

examples.name: python
examples.value:
my_user = linode.User(client, 'username')
grants = None # unrestricted users have no grants

if my_user.restricted:
    grants = my_user.grants

methods.name: GET

methods.description: Update grants for a restricted user.

examples.name: python
examples.value:
my_user = linode.User(client, 'username')
assert my_user.restricted # we can't set grants for unrestricted users

my_user.grants.global.add_linodes = True
my_user.grants.save()

endpoints.description: Manage your user information.

response.name: Profile
response.description: Your User profile information.

schema.name: username
schema.description: The username of the user.

schema.name: email
schema.description: The email address of the user.

schema.name: timezone
schema.description: The selected timezone of the user location.

schema.name: email_notifications
schema.description: Toggles to determine if the user receives email notifications

schema.name: referrals
schema.description: Displays information related to referral signups attributed to the user.

schema.name: code
schema.description: an alphanumeric code unique to each user for use in creating referral URLs.

schema.name: url
schema.description: referral URL based on `code`.

schema.name: total
schema.description: otal number of referrals attributed to user.

schema.name: completed
schema.description: otal number of referrals attributed to user that have converted to full accounts.

schema.name: pending
schema.description: otal number of referrals attributed to user that have not yet converted to full accounts.

schema.name: credit
schema.description: dollar amount of credit based on completed referrals.

schema.name: ip_whitelist_enabled
schema.description: If enabled, logins are only allowed from IPs included on this user's IP Whitelist.  This may not be set to enabled.

schema.name: lish_auth_method
schema.description: Controls what authentication methods are allowed to connect to the Lish console servers.

schema.name: password_keys
schema.description: Allow both password and key authentication

schema.name: keys_only
schema.description: Allow key authentication only

schema.name: disabled
schema.description: Disable Lish

schema.name: authorized_keys
schema.description: Comma-delimited list of authorized SSH public keys

schema.name: two_factor_auth
schema.description: Toggles whether two factor authentication (TFA) is enabled or disabled.

LishSetting.password_keys: Allow both password and key authentication

methods.description: Returns your user information.
methods.name: GET

methods.description: Edits your user's profile.

examples.name: curl
examples.value:
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" \
  -X PUT -d '{
        "username": "jsmith",
        "email": "jsmith@mycompany.com",
        "timezone": "US/Eastern",
        "email_notifications": true,
        "lish_auth_method": "password_keys",
        "authorized_keys": ""
      }
    }' \
    https://api.linode.com/v4/profile

examples.name: python
examples.value:
my_profile.email = 'jsmith@mycompany.com'
my_profile.timezone = 'US/Eastern'
my_profile.email_notifications = True
my_profile.lish_auth_method = 'password_keys'
my_profile.save()
